Meanings: A flammable, colorless gaseous compound of Hydrogen and Sulfur H2S , which in small amounts has the odor of rotten eggs. Sometimes found in Petroleum, it causes the foul smell of Petroleum fractions. In dangerous concentrations, it is extremely corrosive and poisonous, causing damage to skin, eyes, breathing passages, and lungs and attacking and paralyzing the nervous system, particularly that part controlling the lungs and heart. In large amounts, it deadens the sense of smell. Also called : Hepatic Gas of Sulfureted Hydrogen
Halite, also rarely write as : HLTE
Hal, also rarely write as : HLTE
Connection of treating line during well servicing, from pump trucks to tree/well
A worker in the oil industry, especially one in the field
To suspend sucker rods in a derrick or mast on rod hangers rather than horizontally on a rack
A device placed or hung in the casing below the blowout preventer stack to form a pressure tight seal. Pressure is then applied to the blowout preventer stack to test it for leaks
control operation, closing the BOP without first opening an alternate flow path up the choke line. When the BOP is closed, pressure in the annulus cannot be read on the casing pressure gauge

A Pulley that is normally attached to the wellhead at a convenient place for the wireline to pass through as it comes from the stuffing box sheave before being spooled onto the wireline reel. The hay pulley prevents any lateral force from being exerted on the lubricator and the Wellhead
Lost time due to Hole Cleaning problem, Hole cuttings problem, mud rings, fill in hole pack off, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
HYDROCARBON OR GAS DETECTION, Log Curve name
Circulating member with integral landing nipples
High Resolution Induction Log, Induction Log Resistivity
لاگ القایی با تفکیک پذیری کیفیت بالا
بخشی در محل دکل حفاری که متصدی سلامت
ایمنی و حفاظت از محیط زیست است
The partial or complete collapse of the walls of a hole resulting from internal pressures due primarily to swelling from hydration or formation gas pressures. See also : Caving
نفت سنگین که نفت شنگین ایران دارای ای. پی. آی. برابر 30 تا 32 است
HO, with low API and high specific gravity
نفت سنگین که ای. پی. آی. برابر 30 تا 32 دارد
Hesaam Ghafari, He is another Author of Babylon glossary and also designs Websites about oil and gas & oil news, and at present time he works on an offshore rig
حسام غفاری: کسی که گلوسری نفت تایمز را تهیه نموده و دارای وب سایت‌های خبری بسیار برای صنعت نفت و گاز است
HALF FREQUENCY DIELECTRIC TOOL, Log Curve name
A drilling fluid with a pH range above 10.5 i.e., a high
Clay preparations having a yield of 35 to 40 barrels per ton and intermediate between Bentonite and low
yield Clays. Usually prepared by peptizing low
yield Calcium Montmorillonite Clays or, in a few cases, by blending some Bentonite with the peptized low yield Clay
A mechanism in some packers to set and release the tool with a minimum of rotation
سابقە اکتشاف نفت در ایران به حدود 4000 سال پیش می‌رسد. ایرانیان باستان به عنوان مواد سوختی و قیراندود ‏کردن کشتی‌ها
ساختمانها و پشت بامها از این مواد استفاده می‌کردند

نادر شاه در جنگ با سپاهیان هند قیر را ‏آتش زد و مورد استفاده قرار داد در بعضی از معابد ایران باستان برای افروختن آتش مقدس از گاز طبیعی استفاده ‏شده و بر اساس یک گزارش تاریخی یک درویش در حوالی باکو چاه نفتی داشته که از فروش آن امرار معاش ‏می‌نموده است. ‏ در سال 1909 تاسیس شرکت نفت انگلستان و ایران در لندن به ثبت رسید. نخستین چاه نفت 26 ماه مه 1908 در ‏عمق کمتر از 400 متر در مسجد سلیمان به نفت رسیده بود و متعاقب آن دو چاه دیگر. ‏
‎ ‎دارسی برای اکتشاف و استخراج نفت ایران مهندس جورج رینولدز را به ایران فرستاد و در سال 1905 نیز ‏با شرکت انگلیسی نفت برمه شریک شد. رینولدز که معروف به جورج سر سخت بود
بعد از سه سال حفاری در مسجد ‏سلیمان موفق به کشف نفت نشد و بارها توسط دارسی به لندن فرا خوانده شده

اما او هر بار به بهانه ای ‏حفاری را با سرسختی ادامه میداد. سر انجام روزی که آخرین نامە دارسی به دست او رسید و او را به شدت توبیخ ‏کرده بود که: «چرا از دستور اطاعت نمیکنی و پول و سرمایه را بیش از این خودسرانه هدر میدهی ومیبایستی به ‏سرعت خود را به لندن معرفی کنی»
اما باز رینولدز علی رغم دستور دارسی یک روز دیگر به حفاری ادامه داد تا ‏سر انجام به نفت رسید‎. ‎
ویلیام ناکس دارسی از اشراف زادگان انگلیسی بود که از 17 سالگی با خانواده اش ‏برای مدتی دراسترالیا زندگی کرده بود و به استخراج طلا از کوه «مورگن» سرگرم بود
پس از بازگشت و ادامه ‏زندگی در لندن متوجه وجود نفت در ایران شد. پیش از او ژولیوس رویتر موسس خبرگزاری رویتر
با مطالعە ‏یادداشتهای یک زمین شناس فرانسوی که قبلا از ایران دیدن کرده بود
به فکر گرفتن امتیاز اکتشاف و استخراج ‏آن از دولت تهران افتاده بود

‎ ‎دارسی از طریق همکارانش برمفاد یادداشتهای زمین شناس فرانسوی و نیز تلاشهای رویتر وقوف یافت و با ‏یافتن یک دوست رییس الوزراء وقت ایران و واسطه قرار دادن او از سال 1900 با دولت تهران تماس گرفت که ‏سفارت روسیه در تهران متوجه فعالیت‌های او شد و اعتراض نمود
قرارداد در سال 1901 برای مدت 60 ‏سال امضاء شد و پنج استان ایرانی مجاور مرز روسیه از شمول آن مستثنی گردید. دارسی برای دریافت امتیاز نفت ‏ایران مبلغ ناچیزی با وعده تعدادی سهم به ایران داده بود‎. ‎
‎ ‎‏ به هر حال پس از تاسیس شرکت در سال
سهام آن به معرض فروش گذارده شد و دو لرد انگلیسی ‏متعاقب هم مدیر عامل آن شدند
ولی دارسی تا زمان مرگ در سال 1917 عضو هیات مدیره بود ‏‎. ‎
‎ ‎در سال 1914 در آستانە جنگ جهانی اول نیروی دریایی انگلستان 51 درصد سهام این شرکت را دراختیار ‏گرفت که بعدا تا 97 درصد آن متعلق به دولت انگلستان شد
Halite, but mostly write as : Hal
این اختصار بندرت مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
heavy oil, with low API and high Specific Gravity
نفت سنگین که ای. پی. آی. پایین و برابر 30 تا 32 دارد
باز کننده یا گشاد کننده چاه
An arrangement of Pulleys and Wire Rope or Chain used for lifting heavy objects; a winch or similar device
. The Drawworks; to raise or lift
The large Flanged Spool in the Drawworks on which the Hoisting Cable is wound. See also : Drawworks
A mechanical arrangement that prevents the upward movement of certain pieces of equipment installed in a well. A Sucker Rod Pump may use a mechanical hold
down for attachment to a Seating Nipple
Ho, or A device used to enlarge the size of an existing Borehole, having teeth arranged on its outside circumference to cut the Formation as it rotates
وسیله ای که با آن قطر چاه را بیشتر می‌نمایند
homog, or Of uniform or similar nature throughout; a substance or fluid with the same property or composition everywhere

shaped device from which the Swivel is suspended. It is designed to carry maximum loads ranging from 100 to 650 tons, 90 to 590 tonnes and turns on Bearings in its supporting housing. A strong spring within the assembly cushions the weight of a Stand, 90 feet, about 27 meters of Drill Pipe, thus permitting the Pipe to be made up and broken out with less damage to the Tool Join threads. Smaller Hooks without the spring are used for Handling Tubing and Sucker Rods. See also : Stand and Swivel
The weight of the drill stem that is suspended from the Hook

A Packer equipped with friction blocks or Drag Springs and Slips and designed so that rotation of the Pipe unlatches the Slips. The friction springs prevent the Slips from turning with the Pipe and assist in advancing the Slips up a tapered sleeve to engage the Wail of the outside Pipe as weight is put on the Packer. Also called : a Wall
یا قیفی که از آنجا گل حفاری را داخل سیستم می‌ریزند
Oil production in violation of state regulations or transported interstate in violation of federal regulations
HIGH RESOLUTION DIPMETER, Log Curve name
HIGH RESOLUTION DENSITY LOG, Log Curve name
HIGH RESOLUTION TOOL, Log Curve name
HIGH RESOLUTION TEMPERATURE LOG, Log Curve name
بخشی در محل دکل حفاری که متصدی سلامت
ایمنی و حفاظت از محیط زیست است
ناظر ایمنی یا اچ. اس. ای
مسیول ارشد بخشی در محل دکل حفاری که متصدی سلامت
ایمنی و حفاظت از محیط زیست است

Time actually spent for picking up making, Testing, Servicing and lay down of all kinds of drilling. Milling or Coring BHA, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
بیشتر در مورد نفت بکار برده می‌شود
HYDROCARBON OR GAS DETECTION, Log Curve name

An operation in which a specially blended liquid is pumped down a Well and into a Formation under pressure high enough to cause the Formation to crack open, forming passages through which Oil can flow into the Wellbore. Sand grains, Aluminum Pellets, Glass Beads, or similar materials are carried in suspension into the fractures. When the pressure is released at the surface, the fractures partially close on the proppants, leaving channels for Oil to flow through to the Well. Compare with : Explosive Fracturing
A phenomenon in which a pressure concession occurs by suddenly stopping the flow of liquids in a closed container. Also called : Water Hammer

The force exerted by a column of liquid expressed by the height of the liquid above the point at which the pressure is measured. Although "Head" refers to distance or height, it is used to express pressure, since the force of the liquid column is directly proportional to its height. Also called : Head or Hydrostatic Head. Compare with : Hydrostatic Pressure
An accessory or integral part of a Packer used to limit the Packer's upward movement under pressure
A series of Hydraulic Rams to restrain and pull Tubing under Well pressure, temporarily attached to the Wellhead for workover

Organic compounds of Hydrogen and Carbon, whose densities, boiling points, and freezing points increase as their molecular weights increase. Although composed of only two elements. Hydrocarbons exist in a variety of compounds because of the strong affinity of the Carbon atom for other atoms and for itself. The smallest molecules of Hydrocarbons are gaseous; the largest are solids. Petroleum is a mixture of many different Hydrocarbons

A flammable, colorless gaseous compound of Hydrogen and Sulfur H2S , which in small amounts has the odor of rotten eggs. Sometimes found in Petroleum, it causes the foul smell of Petroleum fractions. In dangerous concentrations, it is extremely corrosive and poisonous, causing damage to skin, eyes, breathing passages, and lungs and attacking and paralyzing the nervous system, particularly that part controlling the lungs and heart. In large amounts, it deadens the sense of smell. Also called : Hepatic Gas of Sulfureted Hydrogen
Absorbing or attracting moisture from the air
A Wireline pressure setting tool for setting permanent downhole tools

The force exerted by a body of fluid at rest. It increases directly with the density and the depth of the fluid and is expressed in pounds per square inch or kilopascals. The Hydrostatic Pressure of fresh water is 0.433 pounds per square inch per foot of depth 9.792 kilopascals per meter . In drilling, the term refers to the pressure exerted by the drilling fluid in the Wellbore. In a water drive field, the term refers to the pressure that may furnish the primary energy for production
A Sub with a ball seat run on top of a hydraulically set Packer to set the Packer
